text:
maybe it's common knowledge, but you can do stuff like
```      - name: Hello World
        shell: julia {0}
        run: |
          println("Hello World!")```
which sometimes may simplify things a bit (you can write a proper Julia script across multiple lines instead of cramming everything into a single-line string)

attachments.title: Tip: use Julia as custom shell in GitHub Actions
attachments.text: This isn’t maybe very well-known, but in GitHub Actions you can run commands using custom shells, including julia. For example, in a package I always want to test on CI a package using the latest development revision of a dependency.
